message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.AI. 

The paper addresses the problem of identifying the best candidate answer to a question on Community Question Answer (CQA) forums using a novel induced relational graph convolutional network (IR-GCN) framework. The paper focuses on natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) techniques, which are typically covered in the cs.CL and cs.IR sub-categories. The paper also introduces a modular framework that separates the construction of the graph with the label selection mechanism, which could be relevant to the cs.LG sub-category. The paper's approach involves encoding contrast to create discriminative magnification, which could be relevant to the cs.SI sub-category. Finally, the paper shows that boosting techniques improve learning over familiar stacking, fusion, or aggregation approaches for neural architectures, which could be relevant to the cs.AI sub-category.
